name: 1Password
description: Proprietary graphical user interface for 1Password password manager.

name: Arpwatch
description: Tool that monitors ethernet activity and keeps a database of Ethernet/IP address pairings.

name: Authenticator
description: Open source, two-factor authentication application built for GNOME.

name: bettercap
description: Swiss army knife for network attacks and monitoring.

name: Bitwarden
description: Open source password manager with desktop, mobile, browser, and CLI versions. Cloud or self-hosted.

name: Bitwarden
description: Open source password manager with desktop, mobile, browser, and CLI versions. Cloud or self-hosted.

name: Cinnamon Screensaver
description: Screen locker for the Cinnamon desktop.

name: ClamAV
description: Open source antivirus engine for detecting trojans, viruses, malware & other malicious threats.

name: ClamTk
description: Graphical front-end for ClamAV using Perl and Gtk libraries. It is designed to be an easy-to-use, lightweight, on-demand antivirus scanner for Linux systems.

name: darkstat
description: Captures network traffic, calculates statistics about usage, and serves reports over HTTP.

name: Deepin Screensaver
description: A lightweight Qt5 based screensaver.

name: dsniff
description: Collection of tools for network auditing and penetration testing.

name: EtherApe
description: Graphical network monitor for Unix modeled after etherman. Featuring link layer, IP and TCP modes, it displays network activity graphically. Hosts and links change in size with traffic. Color coded protocols display.

name: GNOME Network Tools
description: GNOME interface for various networking tools.

name: GnuPG
description: The GNU project's complete and free implementation of the OpenPGP standard as defined by RFC4880. Free and Open Source replacement of PGP, mostly used for digital signing of packages.

name: gopass
description: Advanced console based password manager, supporting GnuPG and other backends.

name: GtkHash
description: A GTK utility for computing message digests or checksums

name: gtklock
description: GTK-based lockscreen for Wayland.

name: Hashcat
description: Multithreaded advanced password recovery utility.

name: hping
description: Command-line oriented TCP/IP packet assembler/analyzer.

name: i3lock
description: A simple screen locker. Provides user feedback and uses PAM authentication. The background can be set to an image or solid color.

name: i3lock-color
description: Fork of ''i3lock'' with color and positioning configuration support and can use your desktop with the blur effect applied as a background.

name: IPTraf
description: Console-based network monitoring utility.

name: jnettop
description: top-like console network traffic visualizer.

name: John the Ripper
description: Password cracker.

name: KeePassXC
description: Community fork of KeePassX with more active development. Compatible with KeePass v.1.x (import only) and KeePass v.2.x.

name: KeePassXC
description: Mainly used for password management and generation, but also supports attaching arbitrary files to entries in an encrypted database.

name: Key Rack
description: Password manager for GNOME to view and edit keys, like passwords or tokens, stored by apps.

name: Keysign
description: GTK application to use GnuPG for signing other people's keys. Quickly, easily, and securely.

name: Kismet
description: 802.11 layer2 wireless network detector, sniffer, and intrusion detection system.

name: LastPass
description: Hosted password manager.

name: Light-locker
description: A simple locker (forked from ''gnome-screensaver'') that aims to have simple, sane, secure defaults and be well integrated with the desktop while not carrying any desktop-specific dependencies. It relies on [[LightDM]] for locking and unlocking your session via ConsoleKit/UPower or ''logind/systemd''.

name: LinSSID
description: Graphical wireless scanner.

name: Logwatch
description: Customizable log analysis system.

name: Lynis
description: Security and system auditing tool to harden Unix/Linux systems.

name: MATE Screensaver
description: Screensaver and locker for MATE Desktop Environment.

name: Metasploit Framework
description: An advanced open-source platform for developing, testing, and using exploit code.

name: netsniff-ng
description: High performance Linux network sniffer for packet inspection.

name: ngrep
description: grep-like utility that allows you to search for network packets on an interface.

name: OTPClient
description: Highly secure and easy to use GTK software for two-factor authentication that supports both Time-based One-time Passwords (TOTP) and HMAC-Based One-Time Passwords (HOTP).

name: OWASP ZAP
description: Web application security scanner.

name: Parchive
description: Utility which creates and uses PAR2 files to detect damage in data files and repair them if necessary.

name: pass
description: Simple console-based password manager featuring flat text file organization and GnuPG encryption.

name: Passbook
description: Modern password manager for GNOME.

name: physlock
description: Screen and console locker.

name: QtPass
description: GUI for pass, the standard unix password manager.

name: Revelation
description: Password manager for the GNOME desktop.

name: RHash
description: Utility for verifying hash sums (SFV, CRC, etc). Supports lots of algorithms.

name: Secrets
description: Password manager for GNOME which makes use of the KeePass v.4 format.

name: slock
description: Very simple and lightweight X screen locker. Offers only a black background when locked, there are no animations or text fields.

name: Smb4K
description: Advanced network neighborhood browser and Samba share mounting utility for KDE.

name: ssh-audit
description: SSH configuration auditing.

name: Sshguard
description: Daemon that protects SSH and other services against brute-force attacks, similar to Fail2ban.

name: swaylock
description: Screen locker for Wayland.

name: Tcpdump
description: Common console-based packet analyzer that allows the user to intercept and display TCP/IP and other packets being transmitted or received over a network.

name: Vault
description: Proprietary tool for managing secrets.

name: vlock
description: TTY locker. A mirror of the [https://lists.archlinux.org/archives/list/aur-general@lists.archlinux.org/message/UUI4XXDA5RMOTYOQJUYCES33LE4VY2U5/ original vlock] is available at [https://github.com/WorMzy/vlock github].

name: vnStat
description: Console-based network traffic monitor that keeps a log of network traffic for the selected interfaces.

name: xfce4-screensaver
description: A screen saver and locker that aims to have simple, sane, secure defaults and be well integrated with the xfce desktop.

name: xlockmore
description: Simple X11 screen lock with PAM support.

name: XScreenSaver
description: Screen saver and locker for the X Window System.

name: XSecureLock
description: X11 screen lock utility designed with the primary goal of security.

name: xtrlock
description: Very lightweight X display  locker. Keeps windows visible and displays lock icon instead of mouse cursor. Typing password followed by enter unlocks the screen.
